text.0: the heavens and the earth accordant with all gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his.
text.1: when he came showing forth his majesty and power he drank of soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.
text.2: this majesty of his viṣṇu extols and lauds making the stalcthat gives the meath flow forth with inight.
text.3: when indra maghavan with those who followed him had smitten vṛtra he deserved the choice of gods.
text.4: when bearing warlike weapons fain to win thee praise thou mettest vṛtra yea the dragon for the fight.
text.5: then all the maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled o mighty one thy powerful majesty.
text.6: soon as he sprang to life he forced asun der hosts forward the hero looked to manly deed and war.
text.7: he cleft the rock he let concurrent streams flow forth and with his skilful art stablished the heavens wide vault.
text.8: indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power he forced far from each other heaven and earth apart.
text.9: he hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt a joy to varuṇas and mitras worshipper.
text.10: then to the mighty powers of indra to his wrath his the fierce stormer loud of voice they came with speed.
text.11: what time the potent one rent vṛtra with his strength who held the waters back whom darkness compassed round.
text.12: even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute.
text.13: deep darkness fell upon the slain and indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.
text.14: then all the gods extolled with eloquence inspired by draughts of soma juice thy deeds of manly might.
text.15: as agni eats the dry food with his tcetlv he ate vṛtra the dragon maimed by indras deadly dart.
text.16: proclaim his many friendships met with friendship made with singers with the skilful and the eloquent.
text.17: indra when he subdues dhuni and cumuri lists to dabhīti for his faithful spirits sake.
text.18: give riches manifold with noble horses to be remembered while my songs address thee.
text.19: may we by easy paths pass all our troubles find us this day a ford wide and extensive.
